ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] CSTR Example
ygData.msgSnippet: I would recommend checking out the latest version of the source code from the CVS repository at the Cantera sourceforge site.  Instructions on how to do this

I would recommend checking out the latest version of the source code 
from the CVS repository at the Cantera sourceforge site.  Instructions 
on how to do this are there also.  In general this is the best thing to 
do for anyone building Cantera from the source, since then you always 
have essentially the same version I have, including features not yet in 
the official release. This also allows immediately correcting any bugs, 
rather than having to wait for the next release.

For this reason, anyone who has access to a unix / linux / Mac OSX 
machine with the usual GNU tools may want to consider using Cantera 
there, where it can be built from the source and kept up to date more 
easily than on a Windows PC.  (However, if you are building Cantera 
from the source on Windows, you can also use CVS to check out the 
latest files. )

About the specific missing file - it may be that file 'reactors.h' used 
in that example was added after the last source release. It should be 
in the CVS repository.

Dave



On May 4, 2004, at 6:38 AM, kvirgilm wrote:

> I am trying to get the CSTR example that is posted on this site to
> work.  I am having trouble compiling it.  I get the following error:
>
> g++ -c cstr.cpp
> -I/home/kvm/tools/cantera/cantera-1.5.2/build/include/cantera -O2 -Wall
> cstr.cpp:11:22: reactors.h: No such file or directory
>
>
> It looks like it is missing the reactors.h file.  How make it so that
> it can find it?
